titleStmt.title: Istanbul, Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi), E. H. 216 [= Karatay 92]

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 173 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 216; Qurʾānic Text: Q 2:2-5:120; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 225 x 325mm; Script style: nasḫ; Date of production: 1262-63 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 30: "92 E. H. 216. Kur’andan bir bölüm. Aharlı ve vassaleli kâğıt. 325mm boy 225mm eninde 173 yaprak. Sahifede güzel iri reyhani ile 105mm uzunl.[uğunda] 5 satır. Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī tarafından 661 (1262-63) de istinsah edilmiştir. Güller, duraklar ve son ketebe sahifesi müzehheptir. Cetveller yaldız ve renklidir. Miklep ve şemseli unnabi deri cilt çok tamir görmüştir. Bu mücelletle Baḳara (2) suresinden Māʾida (5) suresinin sonuna kadar vardır. Başta Fātiḥa suresi yoktur."

This can be translated as follows: "92 E. H. 216. A part of the Qurʾān. Sized paper with the technique of vaṣṣālī. 173 leaves of 325 mm height and 225 mm width. The text area written in fine large naskh with diacritics, [contains] 5 lines measuring 105 mm height. Copied by Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī in the year 661 (1262-63). Roses, verse seperators and kataba leaf are illuminated. The part contains the Q 2:2 (Sūra al-Baqara) until the end of of Q 5 (Sūra al-Māʾida). It does not have Sūra al-Fātiḥa.”
